newsitem.title: FRANCE: French Q2 GDP biased by fewer working days - Arthuis.
newsitem.headline: French Q2 GDP biased by fewer working days - Arthuis.

text.p: French Finance Minister Jean Arthuis said on Wednesday that France's second-quarter gross domestic product was marked by fewer working days and could not be compared with German GDP data due for release on Thursday.
Arthuis said first-quarter GDP benefitted because February had 29 days this year.

"In the second quarter...May 1 and May 8 (both public holidays) fell in the middle of the week, which penalises production considerably and to a lesser extent consumption," Arthuis said in a radio interview.
